image.altText: A police officer and a car.

props.synopsis: A 34-year-old woman was fatally shot after allegedly hitting a police officer with a vehicle. The police officer has been released from hospital.

title.children: Investigation continues into fatal police shooting in South Melbourne

image.altText: A street sign at the intersection of Beechwoth-Wangaratta Road in Everton Upper.

props.synopsis: One person has died and three others, including a seven-year-old child, are in hospital following a two-car collision in Victoria's north-east.

title.children: Crash in Everton Upper kills 74yo driver, three others injured

image.altText: His face in the half light, next to a blurred shot of his wife

props.synopsis: John Griffiths fears the only way to avoid a long battle with dementia is flying to Switzerland to end his life. With voluntary assisted dying now legal across almost of Australia, why does it remain off limits to those with dementia?

title.children: John is considering a one-way ticket to Switzerland to avoid dementia

image.altText: The colourful exterior of the Afghan Gallery restaurant on Brunswick Street.

props.synopsis: After 44 years, it's a bittersweet end for the tight-knit family behind the Melbourne institution Afghan Gallery — and the community it has warmly embraced.

title.children: One of Australia's oldest Afghan restaurants set to close after 44 years

image.altText: A man stares contemplatively out over the ocean

props.synopsis: The Yoorrook Justice Commission's deputy chair embarks on a 25-day, 400-kilometre Walk For Truth to Melbourne to hand a report to Victoria's Parliament House.

title.children: Walking 400km in the footsteps of historic Indigenous leaders

image.altText: An orange winged butterfly floats on a purple bush

props.synopsis: "Monarch mother" Ellen Reid has been breeding and releasing butterflies for 50 years, which then travel all over Australia.

title.children: The butterfly breeding effect that's given a town its wings

image.altText: Tim Wilson and Zoe Daniel.

props.synopsis: Following the completion of a full distribution of preferences in the inner-Melbourne seat on Saturday, giving Liberal candidate Tim Wilson a win by 260 votes, independent MP Zoe Daniel has asked for a recount, claiming "errors" and "votes moving to and fro in the final stages of the count".

title.children: Zoe Daniel calls for recount after Tim Wilson wins Goldstein by 260 votes

image.altText: A close up photo of Erin Patterson looking over her shoulder wearing glases.

props.synopsis: A web of messages, search histories, and reset phones has emerged in the Erin Patterson trial. But can digital evidence explain what happened at her dinner table?

title.children: Mother, cook, defendant: Trial of Erin Patterson turns to her personal life

image.altText: A woman with long light brown hair in a white top with floral pattern stares at the camera.

props.synopsis: A company that manages at least 140 disability homes in Queensland is being accused of making misleading claims to property investors.

title.children: Retiree 'forced back to work' after investing in disability accommodation

image.altText: cfa helmet on coffin with flowers

props.synopsis: Hundreds of people attend the funeral of firefighter Simon Lund, who spent his dying days seeking a better deal for others like him with a terminal illness related to their work.

title.children: Much-loved campaigner for fairer go for firefighters remembered

image.altText: A woman with long bright red hair, wearing all black, walks down the street, smiling.

props.synopsis: Union boss Diana Asmar had a clear message for her branch: The traitors who had betrayed her had no idea what was coming. But it was she who took the fall.

title.children: 'Traitors will get what's coming': How a powerbroker fell from her throne

image.altText: An aerial shot of a small town.

props.synopsis: Fosterville Gold Mine is given the go-ahead to expand by the state's planning minister, despite concerns from nearby residents who say the mine causes noise, dust and vibrations in their homes.

title.children: Biggest gold mine in Victoria greenlit to grow despite neighbours' woes

image.altText: Composite image of two women and two men, all smiling.

props.synopsis: A doctor has detailed the final moments of three lunch guests who died from death cap mushroom poisoning after attending a lunch at Erin Patterson's house.

title.children: Lunch guests' illnesses were 'not survivable', doctor tells mushroom trial

image.altText: Destroyed fertiliser silo

props.synopsis: A farmer in Victoria's north-west has taken extreme measures to salvage his stored fertiliser by smashing six silos worth $150,000 to the ground so that he can use it.

title.children: Silos smashed as grain growers face costly nightmare of 'clumped' fertiliser

image.altText: Models on a runway.

props.synopsis: According to the latest National Waste Report, the average Australian throws out about 11 kilograms of clothing each year. But what if some of that could be composted?

title.children: Paper clothes are turning heads and they're more durable than you think

image.altText: Former AFL player Nick Stevens.

props.synopsis: Another witness gives evidence alleging former AFL footballer Nick Stevens defrauded him of tens of thousands of dollars in a dodgy swimming pool scheme.

title.children: Former AFL player Nick Stevens accused of defrauding man of almost $30k

image.altText: A man in a blue shirt and blue jeans wearing a One Nation branded cap walks into court

props.synopsis: A court considering an application by a Victorian MP and her husband for a personal safety order against a One Nation backer has heard the MP's husband shoved the supporter at a car show in regional Victoria.

title.children: MP's husband, One Nation voter in 'push and shove', court hears

image.altText: A woman with her hand up in a crowd at a musical festival.

props.synopsis: People are paying thousands of dollars for accommodation as beds run low across Ballarat for a major music festival.

title.children: Festival goers fork out thousands for Spilt Milk accommodation

image.altText: hepburn shire council

props.synopsis: Ratepayers in Hepburn Shire, home to spa tourist town Daylesford, are outraged with a rates increase to tackle debt.

title.children: Hepburn council sparks outrage by increasing rates by 10pc

image.altText: Smoke and flames are seen billowing from a house on fire

props.synopsis: Arson and Explosives Squad detectives say they have ruled out the male occupant of a home in the Melbourne suburb of Chadstone as a suspect in the house fire that injured a mother and her children.

title.children: Detectives waiting to interview injured mother over Chadstone house fire

image.altText: Ange Postecoglou holds a trophy

props.synopsis: Michael Voss relishes a text message from Carlton supporter Ange Postecoglou after the Europa League final, explaining there are lessons to learn from the victorious Tottenham manager.

title.children: Voss touched by Postecoglou message after Spurs' Europa League win

image.altText: A photo of two police officers standing next to each other in high-vis. Their heads are not in the photo.

props.synopsis: Victoria Police says it will shorten its training program for new recruits by six weeks and overhaul course content.

title.children: Victoria Police shortens its training course for new recruits

image.altText: Police at Morwell crime scene

props.synopsis: A 28-year-old Lakes Entrance man has been interviewed and released by police investigating the discovery of a body at Morwell.

title.children: Police arrest man after body found on side of Victorian highway

image.altText: Firefighting vehicle parked at a property in Melbourne's south-east fringe

props.synopsis: Police say three people were able to flee the fire unharmed but one person, who is yet to be identified, was found dead in a bungalow.

title.children: A person has died in a house fire in Melbourne's south-east

image.altText: A sign welcoming visitors to the Borough of Queenscliffe.

props.synopsis: Queenscliffe CEO Martin Gill has been found to have "likely" breached the Local Government Act over his handling of his own Performance Appraisal.

title.children: Fresh trouble at Victoria's smallest council with formal warning for CEO

image.altText: A close up photo of a man and a woman standing in front of a shop smiling

props.synopsis: The family of a man who was killed alongside his partner in a southern New South Wales car crash says the tragedy could have been avoided.

title.children: Court hears there was 'no dignity' in death of couple in car crash

image.altText: A middle-aged woman in a bright orange rainjacket and a hat smiles while carrying a large white bucket.

props.synopsis: A couple who started experimenting with bioferts five years ago say while it takes time to produce, the results and savings have been worthwhile.

title.children: Farmers blend molasses, manure to brew cut-price fertiliser

image.altText: A photo is displayed on the big screens during Robert Walls Funeral Service at the MCG.

props.synopsis: A decorated player, a ruthless coach and an insightful media performer, Robert Walls is remembered as a "big softie" by his family.

title.children: 'A fortunate life': AFL giant Walls remembered at moving funeral service

image.altText: Two women with sunglasses in the foreground and a man in the background

props.synopsis: A 24-year-old woman has been sentenced to seven and a half years in prison for setting a friend on fire after a night consuming drugs and alcohol.

title.children: Cheers as woman jailed for setting friend on fire while partying

image.altText: Adam Selwood (left) and Joel Selwood (right) smiling and posing for a photograph together.

props.synopsis: Geelong AFL champion Joel Selwood has posted a short tribute to his brother Adam, who died last week aged 41.

title.children: Joel Selwood posts tribute following sudden death of brother Adam

image.altText: A spacious foyer with high ceilings and white walls featuring artwork.

props.synopsis: The 138-year-old Bendigo Art Gallery is set to close later this year for a major makeover that is expected to take two years to complete.

title.children: Bendigo Art Gallery set to close for $45m redevelopment

image.altText: GettyImages-2216418127 (1)

props.synopsis: Bailey Smith said he probably wouldn't have played in the Cats close win over the Dogs if it wasn't against his old side as he's battling a shin injury.

title.children: 'Hopefully we see them in September': Smith already eyeing rematch after close win

image.altText: Carly Findlay sits in a hospital bed. She wears a knitted blue hat with a yellow flower and has a colourful handmade blanket on.

props.synopsis: Carly Findlay knew cancer treatment would be rough. So she made her friends a list.

title.children: Helping someone through cancer treatment? This is what helped me

image.altText: Victorian players in a huddle during a VFLW vs SANFLW game.

props.synopsis: The Office for Women in Sport and Recreation and the Preventing Violence Through Sport Grants Program were both axed in Victorian Treasurer Jaclyn Symes's first budget.

title.children: Victoria axes Australian-first programs boosting gender equity in sport

image.altText: A kelpie farm dog drinks from a water trough on a farm, surrounded by dry, barren paddocks.

props.synopsis: Flooding rain in parts of Australia and forecast local showers during the coming week are unlikely to help Victoria's drought-stricken regions in any significant way, the Bureau of Meteorology says.

title.children: Victoria is in a historic drought. Here's why the NSW deluge won't help
